basic.description:
An introduction to graph theory, one of the central disciplines of discrete mathematics. Topics include graphs, subgraphs, trees, connectivity, Euler tours, Hamiltonian cycles, matchings, independent sets, cliques, colourings, and planarity. Given jointly with MATH 801/3.0.
LEARNING HOURS    120 (36L;84P)
RECOMMENDATION    Experience with abstract mathematics and mathematical proof, and a good foundation in linear algebra.
basic.subject: MATH
basic.title: Graph Theory

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Recommendation    Experience with abstract mathematics and mathematical proof, and a good foundation in linear algebra.
Prerequisites     MATH210 or MATH211 or MATH212 or MATH217.
